description: Number of 2n-bead black-white reversible necklaces with n black beads.
comments: a(n) is the coefficient of c_1^n*c_2^n in the cycle index polynomial for the dihedral group D_{2*n} evaluated with the figure counting polynomial c = c_1 + c_2, n>=1, abbreviated as Z(D_{2*n},c). See, e.g., the Harary-Palmer reference (given under A212355), p. 42, Theorem (PET), and the example for all 6 two-colored 4-bracelets (called there necklaces) on p. 44, Figure 2.4.2. [_Wolfdieter Lang_, Jun 05 2012]
references: Ascher, Marcia; Mu torere: an analysis of a Maori game. Math. Mag. 60 (1987), no. 2, 90-100.
E. M. Palmer and R. W. Robinson, Enumeration of self-dual configurations, Pacific J. Math., 110 (1984), 203-221.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: F. Ruskey, Necklaces, Lyndon words, De Bruijn sequences, etc.

formula: a(n) = ( Sum_{d|n} phi(n/d)*C(2*d, d) )/(4*n) + C(2*k, k)/2, where k = floor(n/2). [_Michael Somos_](A003239(n) + C(2*k, k))/2, where k = [ n/2 ] (R. J. Fletcher, yylee(AT)mail.ncku.edu.tw).
example: a(2) = 2: BBWW, BWBW.a(3) = 3: BBBWWW, BBWBWW, BWBWBW.a(4) = 8: BBBBWWWW, BBBWBWWW, BBBWWBWW, BBWWBBWW, BBWBWBWW, BBWBWWBW, BBWBBWWW, BWBWBWBW.
